title: Apple iPhone 6s Breaks Sales Record
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
29 Sep 2015 05:22 AM EST 
Apple said it sold more than 13 million new iPhone 6s and iPhone 6s Plus devices, a new company record, just three days after hitting retail stores last Friday. The company said iPhone 6s and iPhone 6s Plus will be available in more than 40 additional countries beginning October 9, including Italy, Mexico, Russia, Spain and Taiwan. And, by the end of the year, the new iPhones will be available in over 130 countries. The tech giant has become heavily reliant on the iPhone. Sales of the smartphones account for two-thirds of Apple revenue.
